TypeSignature.Value: Public Interface IMenuItem Implements IDisposable, IJavaObject, IJavaPeerable
public interface class IMenuItem : Android::Runtime::IJavaObject, IDisposable, Java::Interop::IJavaPeerable
public interface IMenuItem : Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable
.class public interface auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit IMenuItem implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type IMenuItem = interface interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: Interface for direct access to a previously created menu item.

remarks.para: Interface for direct access to a previously created menu item.
An Item is returned by calling one of the android.view.Menu#add methods.

For a feature set of specific menu types, see Menu.

Developer Guides
For information about creating menus, read the Menus developer guide.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property AlphabeticModifiers As Integer
public: virtual property int AlphabeticModifiers { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Return the modifier for this menu item's alphabetic shortcut.
Docs.value: Modifier associated with the keyboard shortcut.

remarks.para: Return the modifier for this menu item's alphabetic shortcut. The modifier is a combination of KeyEvent#META_META_ON, KeyEvent#META_CTRL_ON, KeyEvent#META_ALT_ON, KeyEvent#META_SHIFT_ON, KeyEvent#META_SYM_ON, KeyEvent#META_FUNCTION_ON. For example, KeyEvent#META_FUNCTION_ON|KeyEvent#META_CTRL_ON
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AlphabeticShortcut As Char

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CollapseActionView() cil managed

Docs.summary: Collapse the action view associated with this menu item.
Docs.returns: true if the action view was collapsed, false otherwise.

remarks.para: Collapse the action view associated with this menu item. The menu item must have an action view set, as well as the showAsAction flag #SHOW_AS_ACTION_COLLAPSE_ACTION_VIEW. If a listener has been set using #setOnActionExpandListener(OnActionExpandListener) it will have its OnActionExpandListener#onMenuItemActionCollapse(MenuItem) method invoked. The listener may return false from this method to prevent collapsing the action view.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool ExpandActionView() cil managed

Docs.summary: Expand the action view associated with this menu item.
Docs.returns: true if the action view was expanded, false otherwise.

remarks.para: Expand the action view associated with this menu item. The menu item must have an action view set, as well as the showAsAction flag #SHOW_AS_ACTION_COLLAPSE_ACTION_VIEW. If a listener has been set using #setOnActionExpandListener(OnActionExpandListener) it will have its OnActionExpandListener#onMenuItemActionExpand(MenuItem) method invoked. The listener may return false from this method to prevent expanding the action view.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

remarks.para: Return the modifiers for this menu item's numeric (12-key) shortcut. For example, KeyEvent#META_FUNCTION_ON|KeyEvent#META_CTRL_ON

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetActionProvider (actionProvider As ActionProvider) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetActionProvider(class Android.Views.ActionProvider actionProvider) cil managed

Docs.param: The action provider.
Docs.summary: Sets the ActionProvider responsible for creating an action view if the item is placed on the action bar.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Sets the ActionProvider responsible for creating an action view if the item is placed on the action bar. The provider also provides a default action invoked if the item is placed in the overflow menu.
Note: Setting an action provider overrides the action view set via #setActionView(int) or #setActionView(View).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetActionView (view As View) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetActionView(class Android.Views.View view) cil managed

Docs.param: View to use for presenting this item to the user.
Docs.summary: Set an action view for this menu item.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Set an action view for this menu item. An action view will be displayed in place of an automatically generated menu item element in the UI when this item is shown as an action within a parent.
Note: Setting an action view overrides the action provider set via #setActionProvider(ActionProvider).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetActionView(int32 resId) cil managed

Docs.param: Layout resource to use for presenting this item to the user.
Docs.summary: Set an action view for this menu item.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Set an action view for this menu item. An action view will be displayed in place of an automatically generated menu item element in the UI when this item is shown as an action within a parent.
Note: Setting an action view overrides the action provider set via #setActionProvider(ActionProvider).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetAlphabeticShortcut (alphaChar As Char) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetAlphabeticShortcut(char alphaChar) cil managed

Docs.param: The alphabetic shortcut key. This is the shortcut when using a keyboard with alphabetic keys.
Docs.summary: Change the alphabetic shortcut associated with this item.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Change the alphabetic shortcut associated with this item. The shortcut will be triggered when the key that generates the given character is pressed along with the corresponding modifier key. The default modifier is KeyEvent#META_CTRL_ON in case nothing is specified. Case is not significant and shortcut characters will be displayed in lower case. Note that menu items with the characters '\b' or '\n' as shortcuts will get triggered by the Delete key or Carriage Return key, respectively.
See Menu for the menu types that support shortcuts.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Function SetAlphabeticShortcut (alphaChar As Char, alphaModifiers As Integer) As IMenuItem
public: virtual Android::Views::IMenuItem ^ SetAlphabeticShortcut(char alphaChar, int alphaModifiers);
public virtual Android.Views.IMenuItem SetAlphabeticShortcut (char alphaChar, int alphaModifiers);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetAlphabeticShortcut(char alphaChar, int32 alphaModifiers) cil managed
abstract member SetAlphabeticShortcut : char * int -> Android.Views.IMenuItem override this.SetAlphabeticShortcut : char * int -> Android.Views.IMenuItem

Docs.param: The alphabetic shortcut key. This is the shortcut when using a keyboard with alphabetic keys.

The modifier associated with the shortcut. It should be a combination of KeyEvent#META_META_ON, KeyEvent#META_CTRL_ON, KeyEvent#META_ALT_ON, KeyEvent#META_SHIFT_ON, KeyEvent#META_SYM_ON, KeyEvent#META_FUNCTION_ON.
Docs.summary: Change the alphabetic shortcut associated with this item.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Change the alphabetic shortcut associated with this item. The shortcut will be triggered when the key that generates the given character is pressed along with the modifier keys. Case is not significant and shortcut characters will be displayed in lower case. Note that menu items with the characters '\b' or '\n' as shortcuts will get triggered by the Delete key or Carriage Return key, respectively.
See Menu for the menu types that support shortcuts.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetCheckable (checkable As Boolean) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetCheckable(bool checkable) cil managed

Docs.param: Set to true to allow a check mark, false to disallow. The default is false.
Docs.summary: Control whether this item can display a check mark.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Control whether this item can display a check mark. Setting this does not actually display a check mark (see #setChecked for that); rather, it ensures there is room in the item in which to display a check mark.
See Menu for the menu types that support check marks.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetChecked (checked As Boolean) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetChecked(bool checked) cil managed

Docs.param: Set to true to display a check mark, false to hide it. The default value is false.
Docs.summary: Control whether this item is shown with a check mark.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Control whether this item is shown with a check mark. Note that you must first have enabled checking with #setCheckable or else the check mark will not appear. If this item is a member of a group that contains mutually-exclusive items (set via Menu#setGroupCheckable(int, boolean, boolean), the other items in the group will be unchecked.
See Menu for the menu types that support check marks.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetEnabled (enabled As Boolean) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetEnabled(bool enabled) cil managed

Docs.param: If true then the item will be invokable; if false it is won't be invokable.
Docs.summary: Sets whether the menu item is enabled.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Sets whether the menu item is enabled. Disabling a menu item will not allow it to be invoked via its shortcut. The menu item will still be visible.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetIcon (iconRes As Integer) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetIcon(int32 iconRes) cil managed

Docs.param: The new icon (as a resource ID) to be displayed.
Docs.summary: Change the icon associated with this item.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Change the icon associated with this item. This icon will not always be shown, so the title should be sufficient in describing this item. See Menu for the menu types that support icons.
This method will set the resource ID of the icon which will be used to lazily get the Drawable when this item is being shown.

Docs.param: the blending mode used to apply the tint, may be null to clear tint
Docs.summary: Specifies the blending mode used to apply the tint specified by #setIconTintList(ColorStateList) to this item's icon.
Docs.returns: To be added.

remarks.para: Specifies the blending mode used to apply the tint specified by #setIconTintList(ColorStateList) to this item's icon. The default mode is BlendMode#SRC_IN.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Function SetIconTintList (tint As ColorStateList) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetIconTintList(class Android.Content.Res.ColorStateList tint) cil managed
abstract member SetIconTintList : Android.Content.Res.ColorStateList -> Android.Views.IMenuItem override this.SetIconTintList : Android.Content.Res.ColorStateList -> Android.Views.IMenuItem

Docs.param: the tint to apply, may be null to clear tint
Docs.summary: Applies a tint to this item's icon.
Docs.returns: To be added.

remarks.para: Applies a tint to this item's icon. Does not modify the current tint mode, which is PorterDuff.Mode#SRC_IN by default.
Subsequent calls to #setIcon(Drawable) or #setIcon(int) will automatically mutate the icon and apply the specified tint and tint mode using Drawable#setTintList(ColorStateList).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetIntent (intent As Intent) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetIntent(class Android.Content.Intent intent) cil managed

Docs.param: The Intent to associated with the item. This Intent object is not copied, so be careful not to modify it later.
Docs.summary: Change the Intent associated with this item.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Change the Intent associated with this item. By default there is no Intent associated with a menu item. If you set one, and nothing else handles the item, then the default behavior will be to call android.content.Context#startActivity with the given Intent.

Note that setIntent() can not be used with the versions of Menu#add that take a Runnable, because Runnable#run does not return a value so there is no way to tell if it handled the item. In this case it is assumed that the Runnable always handles the item, and the intent will never be started.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetShortcut (numericChar As Char, alphaChar As Char) As IMenuItem
public: Android::Views::IMenuItem ^ SetShortcut(char numericChar, char alphaChar);
public Android.Views.IMenuItem SetShortcut (char numericChar, char alphaChar);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetShortcut(char numericChar, char alphaChar) cil managed
abstract member SetShortcut : char * char -> Android.Views.IMenuItem

Docs.param: The numeric shortcut key. This is the shortcut when using a numeric (e.g., 12-key) keyboard.
The alphabetic shortcut key. This is the shortcut when using a keyboard with alphabetic keys.
Docs.summary: Change both the numeric and alphabetic shortcut associated with this item.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Change both the numeric and alphabetic shortcut associated with this item. Note that the shortcut will be triggered when the key that generates the given character is pressed along with the corresponding modifier key. The default modifier is KeyEvent#META_CTRL_ON in case nothing is specified. Also note that case is not significant and that alphabetic shortcut characters will be handled in lower case.
See Menu for the menu types that support shortcuts.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Function SetShortcut (numericChar As Char, alphaChar As Char, numericModifiers As Integer, alphaModifiers As Integer) As IMenuItem
public: virtual Android::Views::IMenuItem ^ SetShortcut(char numericChar, char alphaChar, int numericModifiers, int alphaModifiers);
public virtual Android.Views.IMenuItem SetShortcut (char numericChar, char alphaChar, int numericModifiers, int alphaModifiers);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetShortcut(char numericChar, char alphaChar, int32 numericModifiers, int32 alphaModifiers) cil managed
abstract member SetShortcut : char * char * int * int -> Android.Views.IMenuItem override this.SetShortcut : char * char * int * int -> Android.Views.IMenuItem

Docs.param: The numeric shortcut key. This is the shortcut when using a numeric (e.g., 12-key) keyboard.

The numeric modifier associated with the shortcut. It should be a combination of KeyEvent#META_META_ON, KeyEvent#META_CTRL_ON, KeyEvent#META_ALT_ON, KeyEvent#META_SHIFT_ON, KeyEvent#META_SYM_ON, KeyEvent#META_FUNCTION_ON.
The alphabetic shortcut key. This is the shortcut when using a keyboard with alphabetic keys.

The alphabetic modifier associated with the shortcut. It should be a combination of KeyEvent#META_META_ON, KeyEvent#META_CTRL_ON, KeyEvent#META_ALT_ON, KeyEvent#META_SHIFT_ON, KeyEvent#META_SYM_ON, KeyEvent#META_FUNCTION_ON.
Docs.summary: Change both the numeric and alphabetic shortcut associated with this item.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Change both the numeric and alphabetic shortcut associated with this item. Note that the shortcut will be triggered when the key that generates the given character is pressed along with the corresponding modifier key. Also note that case is not significant and that alphabetic shortcut characters will be handled in lower case.
See Menu for the menu types that support shortcuts.

format.a: Java documentation for android.view.MenuItem.setShortcut(char, char, int, int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetShowAsAction(valuetype Android.Views.ShowAsAction actionEnum) cil managed

Docs.param: How the item should display. One of #SHOW_AS_ACTION_ALWAYS, #SHOW_AS_ACTION_IF_ROOM, or #SHOW_AS_ACTION_NEVER. SHOW_AS_ACTION_NEVER is the default.
Docs.summary: Sets how this item should display in the presence of an Action Bar.

remarks.para: Sets how this item should display in the presence of an Action Bar. The parameter actionEnum is a flag set. One of #SHOW_AS_ACTION_ALWAYS, #SHOW_AS_ACTION_IF_ROOM, or #SHOW_AS_ACTION_NEVER should be used, and you may optionally OR the value with #SHOW_AS_ACTION_WITH_TEXT. SHOW_AS_ACTION_WITH_TEXT requests that when the item is shown as an action, it should be shown with a text label.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetShowAsActionFlags (actionEnum As ShowAsAction) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetShowAsActionFlags(valuetype Android.Views.ShowAsAction actionEnum) cil managed

Docs.param: How the item should display. One of #SHOW_AS_ACTION_ALWAYS, #SHOW_AS_ACTION_IF_ROOM, or #SHOW_AS_ACTION_NEVER. SHOW_AS_ACTION_NEVER is the default.
Docs.summary: Sets how this item should display in the presence of an Action Bar.
Docs.returns: This MenuItem instance for call chaining.

remarks.para: Sets how this item should display in the presence of an Action Bar. The parameter actionEnum is a flag set. One of #SHOW_AS_ACTION_ALWAYS, #SHOW_AS_ACTION_IF_ROOM, or #SHOW_AS_ACTION_NEVER should be used, and you may optionally OR the value with #SHOW_AS_ACTION_WITH_TEXT. SHOW_AS_ACTION_WITH_TEXT requests that when the item is shown as an action, it should be shown with a text label.
Note: This method differs from #setShowAsAction(int) only in that it returns the current MenuItem instance for call chaining.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: The resource id of the new text to be displayed.
Docs.summary: Change the title associated with this item.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Change the title associated with this item.
Some menu types do not sufficient space to show the full title, and instead a condensed title is preferred. See Menu for more information.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function SetVisible (visible As Boolean) As IMenuItem
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.Views.IMenuItem SetVisible(bool visible) cil managed

Docs.param: If true then the item will be visible; if false it is hidden.
Docs.summary: Sets the visibility of the menu item.
Docs.returns: This Item so additional setters can be called.

remarks.para: Sets the visibility of the menu item. Even if a menu item is not visible, it may still be invoked via its shortcut (to completely disable an item, set it to invisible and #setEnabled(boolean) disabled).
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
